Package test

Class Ball

Object
Ball
Direct Known Subclasses:
RubberBall
public abstract class Ball extends Object
An abstract class which will then be inherited/extended by "Rubberball.Java". It consists of multiple attributes which exists commonly in a ball and an abstract method which must be implemented later on if it were to be inherited.
Author:
KhooChenNan

  • Constructor Details

    • Ball

      public Ball​(Point2D center, int radiusA, int radiusB, Color inner, Color border)
      Constructor for the class "Ball.Java".
      Parameters:
      center - Coordinate for the center value of the ball
      radiusA - First radius for the rubber ball. To be passed in when constructing the rubber ball.
      radiusB - Second radius for the rubber ball. To be passed in when constructing the rubber ball.
      inner - The inner color to be set.
      border - The border color to be set.

  • Method Details

    • makeBall

      protected abstract Shape makeBall​(Point2D center, int radiusA, int radiusB)
      An abstract method which is then later implemented by "Rubberball.Java" as it is extended/inherits "Ball.Java".
      Parameters:
      center - The center coordinates for the ball.
      radiusA - The primary radius of the ball. This will then be modified later on.
      radiusB - The secondary radius of the ball.
      Returns:
      Returns a specific Shape (To be decided on "Rubberball.Java")

    • move

      public void move()
      Sets the location of the ball. As seen from the variable "center", it uses its method "setLocation" then it uses the variable tmp's "setFrame".

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed​(int x, int y)
      Sets the speed of the ball, regardless of horizontal or vertical speed.
      Parameters:
      x - Horizontal speed of the ball.
      y - Vertical speed of the ball.

    • setXSpeed

      public void setXSpeed​(int s)
      Sets the horizontal speed of the ball.
      Parameters:
      s - Horizontal speed of the ball.

    • setYSpeed

      public void setYSpeed​(int s)
      Sets the vertical speed of the ball.
      Parameters:
      s - Vertical speed of the ball.

    • reverseX

      public void reverseX()
      Reverses the horizontal speed of the ball. Mainly used when it comes into contact with something horizontally.

    • reverseY

      public void reverseY()
      Reverses the vertical speed of the ball. Mainly used when it comes into contact with something vertically.

    • getBorderColor

      public Color getBorderColor()
      Getter method for the color of the border.
      Returns:
      Color of the border is returned.

    • getInnerColor

      public Color getInnerColor()
      Getter method for the inner color.
      Returns:
      Inner color is returned.

    • getPosition

      public Point2D getPosition()
      Getter method a specific position of coordinates. To be used on constructions.
      Returns:
      Coordinates "center" is returned.

    • getBallFace

      public Shape getBallFace()
      Getter method for the variable "ballFace" due to its "private" access specifier.
      Returns:
      A shape "ballFace" is returned.

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo​(Point p)
      Moves the ball to a specific location. It takes in a "Point" type parameter "p" and then it sets the center location with that variable.
      Parameters:
      p - The location to be moved to.

    • setPoints

      private void setPoints​(double width, double height)
      Sets the location to a specific coordinates according to the input parameters.
      Parameters:
      width - Used for setting the "left" and "right" coordinates.
      height - Used for setting the "up" and "down" coordinates.

    • getSpeedX

      public int getSpeedX()
      Getter method for the horizontal speed.
      Returns:
      Horizontal speed "speedX" is returned.

    • getSpeedY

      public int getSpeedY()
      Getter method for the vertical speed.
      Returns:
      Vertical speed "speedY" is returned.

    • ballUpGetter

      Getter method for the variable "up" due to its "private" access specifiers.
      Returns:
      Coordinates "up" is returned.
